required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Healthy Caregivers-Healthy Children Phase 3: Children With Special Needs

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to further develop and examine the Health Caregivers Healthy Children (HC2) program, which encourages obesity prevention through promoting healthy eating and physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Mass Index Percentile
primary_outcome.description: Body mass index will be collected on children enrolled using participant's height and weight using a percentile score from 0-100

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Environment and Policy Assessment and Observation tool) and the Healthy Environment Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: Environment and Policy Assessment and Observation Tool has a total score ranging from 0-100 with the higher score indicating greater quality of nutrition

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Healthy Caregivers-Healthy Children (HC2) Survey
secondary_outcome.description: Teacher and parents complete this survey on the number of reported nutrition and physical activity practices

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health Environment Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Healthy Environment Rating Scale has a total score ranging from 0-100 with the higher score indicating increased healthy practices
Parents will complete this survey of stress. The Parent Stress Index ranges from 0-100 with higher scores indicating higher levels of stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Childcare Worker Job Stress Index
secondary_outcome.description: The Childcare Worker Job Stress Index is a total score that ranges from 22 to 110 with higher scores indicating higher levels of stress.

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will receive the Healthy Caregivers-Healthy Children (HC2) intervention for 24 months
Participants in this group will receive the Jump Start intervention for 24 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: Parents/Caregivers of Participants receiving HC2 intervention
arm_group.description: Parents/caregivers of participants receiving the HC2 program will not be receiving any intervention.

arm_group.arm_group_label: No Intervention: Parents/Caregivers of participants receiving Jump Start Intervention
arm_group.description: Parents/caregivers of participants receiving the Jump Start program will not be receiving any intervention.

intervention.description: The HC2 intervention is an obesity prevention program that provides nutrition and healthy activities programs administered weekly via Zoom or in-person.
The Jump Start intervention is a behavioral health and safety program that provides behavior management and safety programs administered weekly via Zoom or in-person.

criteria.textblock:
Center Inclusion Criteria:
1. have >30 children ages 2-to-5 with a with or at-risk for a disability or special healthcare need
2. Serve low income families
3. Reflect the ethnic diversity of the Miami Dade county Public School System (60% Hispanic, 20% non-Hispanic Black, 20% Non Hispanic White).
Child inclusion criteria:
1. Children with an Individual Education Plan or at-risk based on social and economic variables
2. child ages 2-5
3. child enrolled in a childcare center
Exclusion Criteria:
1) Children with feeding tubes or those that bring their own meals due to dietary restrictions
